result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
$4,144.28 is a sole obligation.
Judgment amended on 11/04/14 to reflect restitution as follows:  $310 restitution in 14-CM-346, joint and several plus 10% surcharge; $349.75 restitution in 13-CM-1336, sole obligation plus 10% surcharge.

$486 in Court costs imposed in Ct. 2 and 3 shall be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision in Ct. 1.   
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate to be determined by the DOC and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall have no contact with Marybeth Bria or her residence or family, Michael Jankowski, Sara Bria, Michael Ludwig, Lisa Kaczmarek or their residences and the Windgate Creek BP Gas Station.  
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or dealers.
Defendant shall have no contact with any place where illegal drugs are used, packaged or distributed.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall advise all treating doctors of his drug abuse history.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Statement by Judy A., A.M., and Robyn R.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Presentence Report e-mailed to DA's office & defense counsel
Confidential
Bail/Jail Form
Sentencing hearing on June 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D Bensen for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed and reading waived.  Resolution reached; State moves to amend Ct. 1 to Burglary pursuant to sec. 943.10(1m)(a) and Court so orders.  State further agrees not to charge Trenton Referral #14167.  PSI recommended with both sides free to argue; State agrees to cap confinement recommendation at 3-4 years; no cap on ES but defense free to argue.  State moves to dismiss and read in 13CM1300, 13CM1336 and 14CM346 along with plea to 14CF78 and 14CF104 and Court so orders.  No contest plea entered on amended Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct. 1, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Case not called on the record on 4-28-14.  Per joint request of counsel, global resolution reached and matter adjourned to 5-02-14 at 1:30 p.m.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Hearing on April 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter J. Cannon for State.  Defendant has new charges pending in Br. 1.  Resolution anticipated and special date requested.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Def appears in custody and with Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes. Atty. Mandy Schepper for State. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. Hearing scheduled for 4/2/14 at 2:45 PM
Hearing on April 2, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Absolute sobriety; No contact with victim or his residence; No controlled substances without valid prescriptions; Def shall not possess any firearms
Hearing on March 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Nadya Perez Reyes from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests high cash bond.  $10,000 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:15 am.
